page.title: 11N. Lopham School, 1920's
page.content: Mrs. Potter, grandmother of Michelle who described the village school today, attended this school approximately 1919 - 1930. There were 108 children in the school at that time. Mrs. Potter did not like it. The main work was the usual reading, writing and sums. The only exercise equipment was skipping ropes, but they did play handball. The uniform was a plain dress and apron. There were no school dinners. The school building hasn't changed. It was very strict. The cane was used frequently. It had one blue end and one red. The grandfather of another school child, who has lived in the village for 71 years, says that the village and school have changed very much, but he thinks that life generally is harder, not easier now.
